org.epics.util.text

Class CsvParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.epics.util.text.CsvParser

  • public class CsvParser
extends Object
    Utility class to parse CSV text. The parser is thread safe: it includes an immutable set of parameters and the state for each parsing is kept separate. A change in the parser parameters will create a new parser, so to create your configuration take the closest matching as a template and apply the difference.

    Since there is no CSV strict format, this parser honors as best it can the suggestions found in RFC4180, in the CSV wikipedia article and other sources.

    The parser can try multiple separators, so that it can auto-detect the likely correct one. It does so by trying them one by one, checking that it finds more than one column and that all the rows have the same number of columns. If not, proceeds to the next separator.

    Typical use of the parser: 

     CsvParserResult result = CsvParser.AUTOMATIC
   .withHeader(CsvParser.Header.NONE)
   .parse(new FileReader("table.csv"));

    The parsing of each line is based on code and insights found in Mastering Regular Expressions.

    Author:
    carcassi

    • Field Detail

      • AUTOMATIC

        public static final CsvParser AUTOMATIC
        Automatic parser: auto-detects whether the first line is a header or not and tries the most common separators (i.e. ',' ';' 'TAB' 'SPACE').

    • Method Detail

      • getSeparators

        public String getSeparators()
        Returns the list of separators that are going to be tried while parsing.
        Returns:
        a string with all the possible separators

      • withSeparators

        public CsvParser withSeparators(String separators)
        Creates a new parser that uses the given separators.

        Each character of the string is tried until the parsing is successful.

        Parameters:
        separators - the new list of separators
        Returns:
        a new parser

      • getHeader

        public CsvParser.Header getHeader()
        Returns the way that the parser handles the header (the first line of the csv file).
        Returns:
        the header configuration of the parser

      • withHeader

        public CsvParser withHeader(CsvParser.Header header)
        Creates a new parser with the given header handling.
        Parameters:
        header - the header configuration for the parser
        Returns:
        a new parser

      • parse

        public CsvParserResult parse(Reader reader)
        Parser the text provided by the reader with the format defined in this parser. This method is thread-safe.

        If the parsing fails, this method does not throw an exception but will have information in the result. The idea is that, in the future, the parser can provide multiple reasons as why the parsing failed or event incomplete results.

        Parameters:
        reader - a reader
        Returns:
        the parsed information

      • parseCSVLine

        public static List<Object> parseCSVLine(String line,
                        String separatorChar)
        Parses a line of text representing comma separated values and returns the values themselves.
        Parameters:
        line - the line to parse
        separatorChar - the regular expression for the separator
        Returns:
        the list of values
